questions.question_text: A collaboration engineer configured high availability for Cisco IM and Presence service. The engineer wants to ensure that client failovers do not disrupt other users on the secondary node. What must the engineer configure to accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Should be A
more up to date documentation seems to have moved aways from "CUPC 8.5 And Higher" it reads: "Jabber Client Re-Login Timer"
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/unified-communications-manager-im-presence-service/200958-IM-and-Presence-Server-High-Availability.html#toc-hId-751179664

Selected Answer: A
A seems correct

CUPC 8.5 And Higher - Re-Login Limits (Parameters that apply to this server only) This parameter specifies the minimum number of seconds which CUPC 8.5 (and higher) should wait before attempting to re-login to this server. 

Maximum Requests Per Child Required Field This parameter specifies the maximum number of requests a server process can serve.

XCP Session Manager Configuration Parameters (Clusterwide) Maximum database requests to allow Required Field The number of database requests that can be sent to the XCP Session Manager at one time. When this number is reached, the Cisco XCP core router tells the CM to stop listening on its socket.

choices.C: “Maximum Requests Per Child” on the SIP Proxy service.
choices.D: “EWS Status Frequency” on the Presence Engine service
choices.B: “Maximum database requests to allow” on the XCP Router service.
choices.A: “CUPC 8.5 And Higher - Re-Login Limits” on the Server Recovery Manager service.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
. XCP Connection Manager

The XCP Connection Manager handles client connections and is responsible for maintaining the connection between the Jabber client and the server. However, it might not give you detailed information about the message's path.
C. XCP Router

The XCP Router is responsible for routing XMPP traffic, including instant messages, between different components and servers. If instant messages are not being delivered correctly, the XCP Router trace would be crucial for tracking the message flow and identifying any issues.

Selected Answer: C
I think C is the right answer

Selected Answer: B
Maybe B or C

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/im_presence/configAdminGuide/10_5_1/CUP0_BK_CE43108E_00_config-admin-guide-imp-105/CUP0_BK_CE43108E_00_config-admin-guide-imp-105_chapter_010100.html

End user has issues sending or receiving instant messages.
Perform traces for the listed services on the IM and Presence Service nodes on which the sender and recipient are provisioned.
 Cisco XCP Connection Manager
 Cisco XCP Router

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A collaboration engineer is troubleshooting an issue where a user is reporting that instant messages are not reaching the intended recipient. The engineer is unable to see the full instant message in the trace file. In which trace in the transaction must the engineer resolve this issue?

choices.B: Standard CTI Allow Control of Phones Supporting Rollover Mode
choices.D: Standard CTI Allow Calling Number Modification
choices.A: Standard CTI Allow Reception of SRTP Key Material

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Should be B, but documentation do not specify this

https://ccieme.wordpress.com/2017/01/25/cisco-jabber-in-deskphone-mode/

Enable End Users and Devices for CTI

The Standard CTI Enabled group or a customized group must be added for every Cisco Unified IP phone type.

 Choose the Standard CTI Allow Control of Phones supporting Rollover Mode group for the Cisco Unified IP Phone 6900 Series.
 Choose the Standard CTI Allow Control of Phones supporting Connected Xfer and conf group for the Cisco Unified IP Phone 8900 and 9900 Series.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is troubleshooting an issue with Cisco Jabber for Windows. The end-user reports that Cisco Jabber cannot be used to control a Cisco 8841 IP Phone. The phone appears in the Jabber client, but there is a red x on the icon for the phone. Which end-user option resolves the issue?

A collaboration engineer is installing the Cisco Jabber client from the Windows CLI. The engineer wants to complete a silent installation of the client, clear any existing bootstrap file, and use a Service Domain of cisco.com. Which install command achieves these goals?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A seems correct but there is a mistake
Should be with .exe extension after msiexec

msiexec.EXE /i CiscoJabberSetup.msi /quiet CLEAR=1 SERVICES_DOMAIN=cisco.com

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/jabber/11_0/CJAB_BK_D657A25F_00_deployment-installation-guide-jabber-110/CJAB_BK_D657A25F_00_deployment-installation-guide-jabber-110_chapter_01100.html

The D answer specify could work but the scenario do not specify use of SSO

Selected Answer: C
I agree with C

Selected Answer: C
A is an option, but i stick with this Explantation

 Enable “Send encrypted PII to the Cisco Cloud for troubleshooting” on the Cisco Cloud Onboarding Configuration page: While this option might send some diagnostic information, it's specifically for sending Personally Identifiable Information (PII), which is not necessary for troubleshooting push notification issues and should generally be avoided unless absolutely necessary.

Selected Answer: C
A and C are good, I think C is the correct answer

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/push_notifications/cucm_b_push-notifications-deployment-guide/cucm_b_push-notifications-deployment-guide_chapter_01.html

In the Cisco Cloud Onboarding Configuration window, make sure that the Enable Push Notifications and the I want Cisco to manage the Cisco Cloud Service CA Certificates required for this trust check boxes are still checked. You may need to recheck them.

Step 10
(Optional) Configure troubleshooting settings to ensure that system issues can be resolved quickly. See the online help for field descriptions.
 Check the Send Troubleshooting Information to the Cisco Cloud check box.
 Check the Send encrypted PII to the Cisco Cloud for troubleshooting check box.

questions.question_text: A collaboration engineer is troubleshooting Apple push notification issues and calls Cisco TAC for assistance. The Cisco TAC Engineer indicates that diagnostic information has not been received for the cluster. Which action resolves this issue?

choices.A: Enable “Send encrypted PII to the Cisco Cloud for troubleshooting” on the Cisco Cloud Onboarding Configuration page.
choices.C: Enable “Send Troubleshooting information to the Cisco Cloud” on the Cisco Cloud Onboarding Configuration page.
choices.B: Temporarily enable manual downloads of log files from the Cisco Cloud Onboarding page on Cisco UCM.
choices.D: Temporarily disable push notifications so that Cisco UCM can generate the diagnostics log files.
